creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: plate silver form, European figures with brimmed hats walking by a rail fence, harbor, ship and town in background
text: Almost certainly copied from a drawing by Frederick van Frytom (1652-1702), one of the great Dutch ceramic artists of the seventeenth century, this design was produced for the Dutch market. The scene of marsh and seacoast is thought to be near Scheveningen, Holland. The rim was probably derived from a silver model.
title: Plate with figures in landscape
